case_vignette: An 11-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after he was found screaming and clutching his head! He has had nausea and occasional episodes of vomiting for 1 week, fever and left-sided headaches for 2 weeks, and increasing tooth pain over the past 3 weeks! He has no history of ear or sinus infections! He is in moderate distress! His temperature is 38!7°C (101!7°F), pulse is 170/min, respirations are 19/min, and blood pressure is 122/85 mmHg! He is confused and only oriented to person! The pupils react sluggishly to light! Fundoscopic examination shows papilledema bilaterally! Extraocular movements are normal! Flexion of the neck causes hip flexion!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I've been having nausea, vomiting occasionally, fever, headaches on the left side, and increasing tooth pain.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing nausea and vomiting for 1 week, fever and left-sided headaches for 2 weeks, and tooth pain has been increasing over the past 3 weeks.
Do you have any history of sinus infections or other related conditions?
No, I do not have any history of ear or sinus infections.
Have you had any recent dental procedures or do you have any known dental issues?
No, I haven't had any recent dental procedures and I don't have any known dental issues.
Is there any swelling or redness around your tooth or jaw area?
No, there isn't any swelling or redness around my tooth or jaw area.
Have you experienced any changes in vision or sensitivity to light?
Yes, my pupils react sluggishly to light.
Final Diagnosis: Migraine
